thread.title: Arsenal news: Krystian Bielik impresses Gianfranco Zola on Birmingham City debut | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Krystian Bielik impresses Gianfranco Zola on Birmingham City debut | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Krystian Bielik impresses Gianfranco Zola on Birmingham City debut | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 6:21 pm Arsene Wenger Getty Images) 
Arsenal youngster Krystian Bielik may be one to watch for Arsene Wenger after his side’s embarrassing 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich in the Champions League this week. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
The Gunners fell apart without Laurent Koscielny on the pitch after the Frenchman went off injured at the start of the second half, conceding four goals with Gabriel replacing him at the back. 
Bielik, meanwhile, had a strong debut for loan side Birmingham City in the Championship, with manager Gianfranco Zola hailing his performance. Krystian Bielik hasn’t seen a lot of first-team action at Arsenal (Picture: Getty) 
The 19-year-old has only made League Cup appearances for Arsenal since joining them in 2015, but may be worth considering for the first-team before long given the state of the club’s current defensive options. 
‘In general I would say it was a positive performance from him,’ Zola said after Birmingham’s game against Preston North End.
